title: Convert homepage hero into scrollable multi-banner slider

requirements.text: Replace the current single-message homepage hero banner (HeroSection) with a scrollable banner/slider that shows multiple distinct banners, one per slide, with swipe/drag support on touch devices and clickable navigation controls on desktop.

quotes: I want to change the manin banner section on the homepage to a scrollable banners

acceptanceCriteria: On route '/' the top section renders as a slider/carousel instead of a single static hero message.
Users can change slides on mobile via horizontal swipe/drag.
Users can change slides on desktop via visible navigation controls (e.g., arrows and/or dots).
The hero section retains its existing full-viewport feel (min-h-screen) and does not break the fixed TopNav behavior.

requirements.text: Add accessibility and motion-safe behavior to the hero slider: support keyboard navigation (left/right), provide ARIA labeling for slide controls, ensure focus styles are visible, and respect prefers-reduced-motion (disable autoplay/animated transitions if implemented).

quotes: change the manin banner section on the homepage to a scrollable banners

acceptanceCriteria: Slider navigation controls are reachable and operable via keyboard.
Controls have appropriate accessible names (e.g., aria-label for previous/next and slide indicators).
When prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, slide transitions avoid motion-heavy animations and any autoplay behavior is disabled (if autoplay exists).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Backend remains single-actor Motoko; this change should not require backend changes or state migrations.
nonGoals: Adding new backend APIs or changing lead storage logic.
Adding third-party carousel/analytics services or external dependencies that are not already in the project.
Changing navigation structure outside of wiring the new hero CTAs.

preferencesToAdd: Use English for any user-facing text.
